sub_title: Testability advocate | co-founder Testingscool | Humans in Learning | Romanian Testing Conference
summary:
I have a software testing background, with hands-on technical skills and a genuine interest in the business value testing can provide. 
In the last year, my focus was heavily focused in enabling a testing cultural shift and advocate for testing practices in a company known for their shift-right approach to quality.
- managed in 6 months to build a cultural bridge between Netherlands and Shanghai teams and enabled them to take responsibility for helping each others work
- designed and planned testing learning content and sessions which helped up skilling over 20 individuals to adopt and advocate on testing guidelines and business value in given contexts.
- Testing Strategy more than just a document. Defined and implemented hands-on testing strategies at scale, covering 3 locations over 3 different timezones with 75% of the teams already adopting the practices
- on a monthly basis working directly with senior management roles and teams to define quality related objectives to improve the business decisions and help teams elevate their practices and maximising their business impact.

If defining test strategies, developing tests and testing tools or creating testing habits is a challenge, you may find my working experience in international environments, relevant.
Learning about testing has been a constant in my carreer and my efforts are focused in creating learning opportunities for myself and the community around me.

Humans in Learning startup provides me with the opportunity to use my experience and motivation to support others in learning and ramping up and improve their testing skills.', 'title': 'Humans in Testing coach', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 9360567, 'name': 'Romanian Testing Conference', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQGBT8mIDzbdGg/company-logo_400_400/0/1647627335954?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=jlBSjMv4X5-iVYGVnn9gnSSVDrLBu7qZcRWeH0qKCiU', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/romanian-testing-conference/', 'employees': {'start': 2, 'end': 10}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Cluj County, Romania', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'Romanian Testing Conference', 'description': 'Romanian Testing Community has been created as a reference point for the software testers who want to share and debate ideas and personal experiences related to their common interest, testing or Quality Assurance.

People have always felt the need to be part of a social entity that shared the same values and principles, as they understood that the power of groups surpasses that of the individual when it comes to changing the mindsets, development and evolution.

Since 2011, the mission of Romanian Testing Community is to bring people together, to put them in one place and connect them through their common passion and interest. Because great ideas are built only if shared and polished with different opinions and different views, the community is here to do that for the software quality assurance professionals in Romania.

Therefore, if you think you know valuable stuff about testing, or you want to learn new things from our members, or just express your opinion on some topic, get in touch with us via LinkedIn and Facebook and meet us once a year at the Annual Testing Conference.', 'title': 'Co-Founder', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 20992, 'name': 'Backbase', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D4E0BAQFOmtTiVwZYvA/company-logo_400_400/0/1665989805683?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=dz-GNA-AN0h0bGEX1BxB_wdFGfuguTespODta14Dhdw', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/backbase/', 'employees': {'start': 1001, 'end': 5000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Amsterdam Area, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'company': 'Backbase', 'description': "As a  Principal QA role I was responsible for delivering a high quality testing service towards delivery teams across the company. The mission of the role is to work with teams to deliver the proper knowledge, process, tooling and best practices that allows teams to release high quality, highly performant releases.
While some key obectives are derived from company's OKRs, large part of the role involves identifying key stakeholders and their needs, gather requirements and creating a comprehensive and consistent technical backlog which, ultimately, enables the delivery teams to meet the commitment towards stakeholders
Key activities of my role involve:
- identifying areas of improvement and negotiate priorities with relevant stakeholders
- hands-on technical implementation of various automation proof of concepts and test frameworks - technologies include (Java, Maven, Xunit frameworks, RestAssured, Typescript, Protractor, Jenkins, Docker, K8S, Gatling & Grafana etc.)
- participate and challenge technical implementations
- identify and define Quality Attributes/NFRs in a S.M.A.R.T approach
- Maintain healthy communication within the team and outside
 
There are also several skills I've started to develop while being part of this role:
- Banking Business Knowledge
- Negotiation
- Stakeholder management", 'title': 'Principal QA Engineer', 'employment_type': 'Contract'}]}, {'company': {'id': 2854996, 'name': 'iWelcome', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQEFm29ck6BAWw/company-logo_400_400/0/1579479407998?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=JhVFRl16xdhZgNLunRiSG8fdycw-IysqX5pO437v0gs', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/iwelcome/', 'employees': {'start': 51, 'end': 200}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'company': 'iWelcome', 'description': "iWelcome provides Identity & Access Management as-a-Service (IDaaS). With iWelcome’s cloud platform, organisations manage the identity lifecycle, the profiles and the access rights of their consumers, employees & business partners in a user friendly and secure manner.
My role involves defining and guiding the testing strategy across the entire microservices landscape. From designing test automation frameworks to test automation implementation or performance testing, are all part of role's responsability.
The context I currently enjoy the most is solving the software delivery challenges of small and repeatable iterations, supported by automated checks and tests, in a timely and efficient manner, while keeping the engineering and business enganged in the entire effort.
The company landscape offers a Continuous Delivery platform, over a microservice-oriented architecture. For people inlove with tools, at the moment I'm writing this, I use: RestAssured, Postman, Spring Cloud Contract, Taurus, my Brain and lots of Heuristics

During iWelcome time my activities involved:
- Defining and implementing the Continuous Delivery pipeline
- implementation of quality checks per each stage of the pipeline
- defining the Performance approach, scenarios and execution approach
- reviewing test automation approach for all frameworks and quality checks implemented during delivery lifecycle
- bridging communication gaps between Product Owners and delivery teams", 'title': 'Test Architect', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 1101826, 'name': 'Qubiz', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQEjyi-XB_JHVg/company-logo_400_400/0/1562315090812?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=mTwmpwZi-HzLZvqHYaQRDjHXDxpP1vl94M8JA3grj1E', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/qubiz/', 'employees': {'start': 201, 'end': 500}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Cluj-Napoca', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'company': 'Qubiz', 'description': 'It is not about whether people are able to do testing or not, is about the value their testing activities bring to your business. 
I work with project teams to help them reach their quality goal. I support clients to define their expectations and get a clear perspective of their investment in software.

When it comes to Test Automation I felt the pain and frustration when not done properly. I work with delivery teams and test automation teams to ensure a consistent approach in achieving their goals. Towards reaching the goals, plenty of challenges are encountered and best practices are overseen. I use my experience in helping teams to overcome those challenges, benefit from the real advantages of test automation and deliver software within time and within budget.

My testing experience is driven by direct communication with people. When time allows I’m also involved in forums, blogging, conferences and tech events where, from time to time, I get to speak at. While I discourage narrowed testing and repetitive tasks, I motivate and coach people to find their inner tester and approach activities from a personal perspective. Discovering patterns, observing things, exploring new possibilities is what helps me in achieving my goals as a tester. My areas of interest also include: highly scalable test automation architectures, cloud technologies and custom based  testing solutions.

As a test tester I can:
tell what testing means for me and explain my approach in any given moment
identify context switches and apply my skills and knowledge accordingly
help in approaching testing as a team
accept and deal with ambiguity, specific results and partial answers
design experiments, apply test techniques and objectively observe behaviours to take decisions', 'title': 'Enthusiastic Test Architect Consultant', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 12796, 'name': 'ISDC', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQFF-mRfmggSTQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1549379235813?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=71abufsZRu0tAFShqd8pJiGhdXmDPyPicsCRuC-kt7k', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/isdc/', 'employees': {'start': 1001, 'end': 5000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Cluj County, Romania', 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'company': 'ISDC - A Member of the Endava Group', 'description': "Within ISDC my responsibilities are:
- providing Technical Leadership and Strategic Direction to Testing Community
- providing workshops and mentoring testers in various aspects of testing activity (automation, performance, test management, tooling, processes)
- creating Test Strategies for projects
- provide testing consultancy to company clients
- responsible in bridging the gap between software architects and testers
- responsible with testing processes within the company
- maintaining a “big and complete” picture view of the product, its dependencies, organizational goals, technology arena, etc. and helps guide & direct the functioning of the Testing Community, appropriately.
- helps with Test plan development
- involved in interviewing candidates for testing positions
- mentoring and coaching people with focus on technology and personal development plans

[{'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'role': 'Continental STWC', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Software Testing World Cup', 'logo': None, 'url': None}, 'cause': 'EDUCATION', 'description': 'The Software Testing World Cup (STWC) is a tournament for all testing practitioners around the globe to show off their skills and compete with other international testing professionals. It brings the testing craft into the spotlight and gives the profession a competitive event on a global scale.
Responsibilities include:
• Judging: reading Testreports reviewing Bugs, give rating points as well as
text feedback for all continents
• Amount of teams which need to be judged: depending on participants
and amount of judges
• Connect with STWC via Twitter, YouTube, Google+ & subscribe to our Newsletter
• Help promote the World Cup: invite/ask your contacts to form a team and to participate
• Coordinate the Main continental judges and remind them on their duties,
• Help them making final decision if judgments are equal
• Make suggestions for possible interested continental Judges
Additional expectations
• Write a Blog post afterwards about the Continental Competition
• Send out tweets in general & during the competition, join the continental

Benefits
• Visibility on STWC webpage (your Name, Photo + Bio)
• Free Ticket for Agile Testing Days Conf, travel + hotel costs reimbursed
